verses.verse: Furthermore Elihu <S%H453><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> <S%H8799><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%>,
Hear <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8798><s%> my words <S%H4405><s%>, O ye wise <S%H2450><s%> men; and give ear <S%H238><s%> <S%H8685><s%> unto me, ye that have knowledge <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8802><s%>.
For the ear <S%H241><s%> trieth <S%H974><s%> <S%H8799><s%> words <S%H4405><s%>, as the mouth <S%H2441><s%> tasteth <S%H2938><s%> <S%H8799><s%> meat <S%H398><s%> <S%H8800><s%>.
Let us choose <S%H977><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to us judgment <S%H4941><s%>: let us know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8799><s%> among ourselves what is good <S%H2896><s%>.

For I-yov <S%H347><s%> hath said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, I am righteous <S%H6663><s%> <S%H8804><s%>: and 'Elohim <S%H410><s%> hath taken away <S%H5493><s%> <S%H8689><s%> my judgment <S%H4941><s%>.
Should I lie <S%H3576><s%> <S%H8762><s%> against my right <S%H4941><s%>? my wound <S%H2671><s%> is incurable <S%H605><s%> <S%H8803><s%> without transgression <S%H6588><s%>.
What man <S%H1397><s%> is like I-yov <S%H347><s%>, who drinketh up <S%H8354><s%> <S%H8799><s%> scorning <S%H3933><s%> like water <S%H4325><s%> ?

Which goeth <S%H732><s%> <S%H8804><s%> in company <S%H2274><s%> with the workers <S%H6466><s%> <S%H8802><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%>, and walketh <S%H3212><s%> <S%H8800><s%> with wicked <S%H7562><s%> men <S%H582><s%>.
For he hath said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, It profiteth <S%H5532><s%> <S%H8799><s%> a man <S%H1397><s%> nothing that he should delight <S%H7521><s%> <S%H8800><s%> himself with 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>.

Therefore hearken <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8798><s%> unto me, ye men <S%H582><s%> of understanding <S%H3824><s%>: far be it <S%H2486><s%> from 'Elohim <S%H410><s%>, that he should do wickedness <S%H7562><s%>; and from 'El SHaddai <S%H7706><s%>, that he should commit iniquity <S%H5766><s%>.

For the work <S%H6467><s%> of a man <S%H120><s%> shall he render <S%H7999><s%> <S%H8762><s%> unto him, and cause every man <S%H376><s%> to find <S%H4672><s%> <S%H8686><s%> according to his ways <S%H734><s%>.
Yea, surely <S%H551><s%> 'Elohim <S%H410><s%> will not do wickedly <S%H7561><s%> <S%H8686><s%>, neither will 'El SHaddai <S%H7706><s%> pervert <S%H5791><s%> <S%H8762><s%> judgment <S%H4941><s%>.
Who hath given him a charge <S%H6485><s%> <S%H8804><s%> over the earth <S%H776><s%>? or who hath disposed <S%H7760><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the whole world <S%H8398><s%> ?
If he set <S%H7760><s%> <S%H8799><s%> his heart <S%H3820><s%> upon man, if he gather <S%H622><s%> <S%H8799><s%> unto himself his spirit <S%H7307><s%> and his breath <S%H5397><s%>;
All flesh <S%H1320><s%> shall perish <S%H1478><s%> <S%H8799><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>, and man <S%H120><s%> shall turn again <S%H7725><s%> <S%H8799><s%> unto dust <S%H6083><s%>.
If now thou hast understanding <S%H998><s%>, hear <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8798><s%> this: hearken <S%H238><s%> <S%H8685><s%> to the voice <S%H6963><s%> of my words <S%H4405><s%>.

Shall even he that hateth <S%H8130><s%> <S%H8802><s%> right <S%H4941><s%> govern <S%H2280><s%> <S%H8799><s%>? and wilt thou condemn <S%H7561><s%> <S%H8686><s%> him that is most <S%H3524><s%> just <S%H6662><s%> ?
Is it fit to say <S%H559><s%> <S%H8800><s%> to a king <S%H4428><s%>, Thou art wicked <S%H1100><s%>? and to princes <S%H5081><s%>, Ye are ungodly <S%H7563><s%> ?

How much less to him that accepteth <S%H5375><s%> <S%H8804><s%> not the persons <S%H6440><s%> of princes <S%H8269><s%>, nor regardeth <S%H5234><s%> <S%H8765><s%> the rich <S%H7771><s%> more than <S%H6440><s%> the poor <S%H1800><s%>? for they all are the work <S%H4639><s%> of his hands <S%H3027><s%>.

In a moment <S%H7281><s%> shall they die <S%H4191><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and the people <S%H5971><s%> shall be troubled <S%H1607><s%> <S%H8792><s%> at midnight <S%H2676><s%> <S%H3915><s%>, and pass away <S%H5674><s%> <S%H8799><s%>: and the mighty <S%H47><s%> shall be taken away <S%H5493><s%> <S%H8686><s%> without hand <S%H3027><s%>.
For his eyes <S%H5869><s%> are upon the ways <S%H1870><s%> of man <S%H376><s%>, and he seeth <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8799><s%> all his goings <S%H6806><s%>.
There is no darkness <S%H2822><s%>, nor shadow of death <S%H6757><s%>, where the workers <S%H6466><s%> <S%H8802><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%> may hide <S%H5641><s%> <S%H8736><s%> themselves.
For he will not lay <S%H7760><s%> <S%H8799><s%> upon man <S%H376><s%> more than right; that he should enter <S%H1980><s%> <S%H8800><s%> into judgment <S%H4941><s%> with 'Elohim <S%H410><s%>.
He shall break in pieces <S%H7489><s%> <S%H8799><s%> mighty men <S%H3524><s%> without number <S%H2714><s%>, and set <S%H5975><s%> <S%H8686><s%> others <S%H312><s%> in their stead.

Therefore he knoweth <S%H5234><s%> <S%H8686><s%> their works <S%H4566><s%>, and he overturneth <S%H2015><s%> <S%H8804><s%> them in the night <S%H3915><s%>, so that they are destroyed <S%H1792><s%> <S%H8691><s%>.
He striketh <S%H5606><s%> <S%H8804><s%> them as <S%H8478><s%> wicked men <S%H7563><s%> in the open <S%H4725><s%> sight <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8802><s%> of others;
Because they turned back <S%H5493><s%> <S%H8804><s%> from him <S%H310><s%>, and would not consider <S%H7919><s%> <S%H8689><s%> any of his ways <S%H1870><s%>:

So that they cause the cry <S%H6818><s%> of the poor <S%H1800><s%> to come <S%H935><s%> <S%H8687><s%> unto him, and he heareth <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the cry <S%H6818><s%> of the afflicted <S%H6041><s%>.

When he giveth quietness <S%H8252><s%> <S%H8686><s%>, who then can make trouble <S%H7561><s%> <S%H8686><s%>? and when he hideth <S%H5641><s%> <S%H8686><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%>, who then can behold <S%H7789><s%> <S%H8799><s%> him? whether it be done against a nation <S%H1471><s%>, or against a man <S%H120><s%> only <S%H3162><s%>:
That the hypocrite <S%H120><s%> <S%H2611><s%> reign <S%H4427><s%> <S%H8800><s%> not, lest the people <S%H5971><s%> be ensnared <S%H4170><s%>.
Surely it is meet to be said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8736><s%> unto 'Elohim <S%H410><s%>, I have borne <S%H5375><s%> <S%H8804><s%> chastisement, I will not offend <S%H2254><s%> <S%H8799><s%> any more:

That which I see <S%H2372><s%> <S%H8799><s%> not <S%H1107><s%> teach <S%H3384><s%> <S%H8685><s%> thou me: if I have done <S%H6466><s%> <S%H8804><s%> iniquity <S%H5766><s%>, I will do <S%H3254><s%> <S%H8686><s%> no more.

Should it be according to thy mind? he will recompense <S%H7999><s%> <S%H8762><s%> it, whether thou refuse <S%H3588><s%> <S%H3988><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, or whether thou choose <S%H977><s%> <S%H8799><s%>; and not I: therefore speak <S%H1696><s%> <S%H8761><s%> what thou knowest <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8804><s%>.
Let men <S%H582><s%> of understanding <S%H3824><s%> tell <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%> me, and let a wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H1397><s%> hearken <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8802><s%> unto me.
I-yov <S%H347><s%> hath spoken <S%H1696><s%> <S%H8762><s%> without knowledge <S%H1847><s%>, and his words <S%H1697><s%> were without wisdom <S%H7919><s%> <S%H8687><s%>.

My desire <S%H15><s%> <S%H8676><s%> <S%H1><s%> is that I-yov <S%H347><s%> may be tried <S%H974><s%> <S%H8735><s%> unto the end <S%H5331><s%> because of his answers <S%H8666><s%> for wicked <S%H205><s%> men <S%H582><s%>.

For he addeth <S%H3254><s%> <S%H8686><s%> rebellion <S%H6588><s%> unto his sin <S%H2403><s%>, he clappeth <S%H5606><s%> <S%H8799><s%> his hands among us, and multiplieth <S%H7235><s%> <S%H8686><s%> his words <S%H561><s%> against 'Elohim <S%H410><s%>.
